verses.text: 王的宣告尼布甲尼撒王向住在全地的各國、各族和說各種語言的人宣告說：「願你們大享平安！

words.note: Used as a title after a name.

verses.text: 我樂意把至高的 神向我所行的神蹟奇事宣揚出來。

words.note: Indicates object is placed before verb for emphasis.
Often used to refer to God as 'The Most High God'.
Forms a nominal phrase with the following verb.

verses.text: 他的神蹟多麼偉大，他的奇事多麼有力；他的國是永遠的國，他的統治直到萬代！

words.note: Refers to countless or all future generations.
A measure word specifically for verses or sections of text.
The authoritative Hebrew text of the Jewish Bible.

verses.text: 「我尼布甲尼撒安逸地住在家中，在宮裡享受榮華富貴。

words.note: Connects an adjective to a verb to form an adverbial phrase.
A fixed four-character idiom (chengyu).

verses.text: 我作了一個夢，這夢使我懼怕；我在床上所見的夢幻和我腦海中出現的異象，都使我驚惶。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase with the following verb.
Lit. 'brain sea', meaning the recesses of the mind.
Used as a locative suffix indicating 'within' or 'in the midst of'.

verses.text: 我就下令把巴比倫所有的智慧人，都帶到我面前來，要他們把夢的意思向我說明。

words.note: Indicates a logical consequence or immediate action.
Preposition marking a direct object placed before the verb.
Indicates movement towards the speaker/subject.

verses.text: 於是術士、用法術的、迦勒底人和占星家都進來；我當面把那夢告訴了他們，可是他們卻不能把夢的意思向我說明。

words.note: Lit. 'those who use magic arts'.
Emphasizes a contrast or unexpected turn.

verses.text: 把夢告訴但以理「最後，那照著我神的名，稱為伯提沙撒的但以理，來到我面前，他裡面有聖神的靈，我就把夢告訴他：

words.note: Refers to the king's god(s) here, used as a proper noun.
Refers to a divine spirit, contextually from God.

verses.text: 『術士的領袖伯提沙撒啊！因為我知道你裡面有聖神的靈，沒有甚麼隱祕的事能難倒你；因此，你要把我夢中所見的異象和夢的意思告訴我。
我躺在床上時腦海中所見的異象是這樣：我看見大地中間，有一棵樹，十分高大。

words.note: Figurative: 'sea of the brain' for the mind.

verses.text: 那樹漸長，而且堅強，高達於天，地極所有的人都看得到。

words.note: More formal or literary than '慢慢長大'.
Classical preposition often seen in Biblical Chinese.
Common phrase in biblical texts referring to remotest parts of the world.
Structure 'verb + 得 + complement' indicates possibility/ability.

verses.text: 它的葉子美麗，果實繁多，所有的生物都從它得到食物；野地的走獸在它下面歇息，空中的飛鳥棲宿在它的枝頭上；各種生物都從它得著供養。

words.note: More formal than just '很多'.
Often refers to wilderness or open country in biblical contexts.
Specific term for land animals, especially wild ones, in religious texts.
More formal or literary than '休息'.
A common poetic/biblical term for birds, often referring to all birds.
More formal/literary than '棲息' or '住宿'.
Archaic/literary variant of '得到'.
Can also be a verb; here refers to what is provided.

verses.text: 「『我躺在床上，在我腦海出現的異象中，我看見有一位守望者，就是聖者，從天上下來，

words.note: Literally 'brain sea', refers to one's thoughts or mind.
Refers to a divine or supernatural vision.
A common role in biblical prophecy and narratives.
Refers to a divine being or a holy person.
Can mean 'in the sky' or 'in heaven' depending on context.

verses.text: 大聲呼叫，這樣說：你們要砍下這樹，削斷枝子，搖落葉子，打散果子，把樹下的走獸趕散，把樹枝上的飛鳥趕走。

words.note: Often used in literary or poetic contexts for leaves falling.
A grammatical particle used to move the object before the verb.

verses.text: 然而，樹根的餘幹卻要留在地上，用鐵和銅的鍊子圍住，留在野地的青草中，使他被天露滴濕；使他像走獸一樣在地上的草叢中得他的分。

words.note: Refers to the leftover part of a tree trunk after cutting.
Often has a divine or miraculous connotation in religious texts.
A descriptive verb compound for becoming wet by dripping liquid.

verses.text: 使他的心改變，不再是人的心，給他一個獸心，使他經過七年的時期。
這是守望者宣告的裁決，是聖者頒布的決定，好使世人都知道：至高者在世人的國中掌權，他喜歡把國賜給誰，就賜給誰，甚至立最卑微的人執掌國權。

words.note: Indicates purpose or result.
Lit. 'people of the world'.
Refers to God in the Bible.
Often used for divine or royal grants.
Often used for divine or royal grants.
Describes status, not necessarily character.
Refers to the power of a kingdom or king.

verses.text: 「『這就是我尼布甲尼撒王所作的夢。伯提沙撒啊！你要把這夢的意思告訴我，因為我國中所有的智慧人都不能把夢的意思向我說明；只有你能，因為你裡面有聖神的靈。』」

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb.
Refers to a divine, holy spirit.
Can mean spirit, soul, or ghost. Here, divine spirit.

verses.text: 但以理為王解夢於是那稱為伯提沙撒的但以理驚愕片時，他想到的事使他驚惶。王對他說：「伯提沙撒啊！別讓這夢和夢的意思使你驚惶。」伯提沙撒回答說：「我主啊！願這夢歸給憎恨你的人，夢的意思歸給你的敵人。

words.note: A respectful address to a superior.

verses.text: 你所見的樹漸長，而且堅強，高達於天，全地的人都看得到。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb.
Classical Chinese preposition.
Verb-complement construction indicating possibility.

verses.text: 它的葉子美麗，果實繁多，所有的生物都從它得到食物；野地的走獸住在它下面，空中的飛鳥棲在它的枝頭上。

words.note: Specifically refers to land animals, distinct from 'flying birds'.
Used as a suffix indicating location 'on' or 'above'.

verses.text: 王啊！你就是那樹，越來越偉大堅強；你的威勢漸長，高達於天；你的權柄直到地極。

words.note: Classical Chinese preposition, used to denote location or extent.
Often used in religious or formal contexts to denote divine or supreme authority.
A common biblical idiom referring to the farthest reaches of the world.

verses.text: 王既然看見一位守望者，就是聖者，從天上下來，說：『你們要砍下毀壞這樹，樹根的餘幹卻要留在地上，用鐵和銅的鍊子圍住，留在野地的青草中，使他被天露滴濕；使他的分和野地的走獸一樣，直到他經過那七年的時期。』

words.note: Often refers to a spiritual guardian or prophet in biblical contexts.
Refers to a holy being, like an angel or God himself, in scripture.
Refers to the leftover stump of a cut-down tree.
Refers to dew as a form of divine provision or moisture.

verses.text: 王啊！夢的意思就是這樣：這臨到我主我王的事，是至高者的裁決。

words.note: A respectful address used in scripture.
A respectful address used in scripture.
A title for God, emphasizing his supreme authority.

verses.text: 你必被趕逐，離開人群，和野地的走獸同住；你必像牛一樣吃草，被天露滴濕，要經過七年的時期；等到你承認至高者在世人的國中掌權，他喜歡把國賜給誰，就賜給誰。

words.note: A formal term for giving, often implying a gift from a superior or divine being.

verses.text: 守望者既然吩咐要留下樹根的餘幹，所以，等到你承認上天的至高者是掌權的，你的國就必再歸給你。

words.note: Refers to heavenly messengers or angels in prophetic visions.
Refers to the stump left after a tree is cut, symbolizing hope of renewal.
In this context, often refers to God or divine authority.
A common biblical title for God.

verses.text: 因此，王啊！請你接納我的勸告，施行公義，斷絕罪過，憐憫受欺壓者，斷絕罪孽，你的平安或者可以延長。」

words.note: Used as a vocative.

verses.text: 夢境應驗這一切事都在尼布甲尼撒王身上實現了。

words.note: A common phrase meaning 'on/with' someone, often implying 'happened to'.

verses.text: 過了十二個月，王在巴比倫王宮的平頂上散步的時候，

words.note: Used in conjunction with 時候 to form 'when...'

verses.text: 他說：「這大巴比倫城不是我用大能大力建造作我的京都，為顯我威嚴的榮耀嗎？」

words.note: Often used together with 大能 as a set phrase for immense power.

verses.text: 這話在王的口中還沒有說完，就有聲音從天上傳下來，說：「尼布甲尼撒王啊！你的王權被褫奪了。

words.note: A formal and literary term for stripping away status or power.

verses.text: 你必被趕逐，離開人群，和野地的走獸同住；你必像牛一樣吃草，要經過七年的時期；等到你承認至高者在世人的國中掌權，他喜歡把國賜給誰，就賜給誰。」

words.note: Refers to animals that walk, as opposed to flying or swimming.
Refers to God, the Most High.

verses.text: 這話立刻就應驗在尼布甲尼撒身上；他被趕逐，離開人群，像牛一樣吃草，身體被天露滴濕，直到他的頭髮長得像鷹毛，指甲像鳥爪。

words.note: Often used in the context of prophecy being fulfilled.

verses.text: 「七年的日子滿了，我尼布甲尼撒舉目望天，我的理智恢復過來，我就稱頌至高者，讚美尊崇活到永遠的 神。他的統治永無窮盡，他的國度直到萬代。

words.note: A formal way to say 'look up'.
A formal term for praising or glorifying, often God.
Refers to God, the Most High.
Commonly used for praising God or expressing admiration.
To hold in high esteem and worship.
Capitalized when referring to the monotheistic God.
An idiom emphasizing perpetuity.
Often used specifically for 'Kingdom of God/Heaven'.
Implies endless generations, eternity.

verses.text: 地上所有的居民，在他來說都是虛無；在天上的萬軍中，他憑自己的意旨行事；在地上的居民中，也是這樣；沒有人能攔住他的手，或問他說：『你作甚麼？』

words.note: Often used in philosophical or religious texts to mean 'vain' or 'of no account'.
Refers to heavenly hosts or innumerable armies, often of angels.
Often refers to divine will or purpose.

verses.text: 「那時，我的理智恢復過來後，為著我國的光榮，我的威嚴和光輝也都恢復過來了。我的謀臣和官員仍來求見我，我的王權重新堅立，我的權勢越發增加。

words.note: Indicates a return to a previous state or completion of action.
Indicates a return to a previous state or completion of action.

verses.text: 現在我尼布甲尼撒讚美、尊崇、榮耀天上的王，因為他所作的一切都正確，他所行的也都公平；行為驕傲的，他都能貶低。」

words.note: Indicates the object or result of a verb.
Indicates the object or result of a verb.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun or pronoun equivalent.
